description: Mango leaves are long, narrow, and leathery with a pointed tip. They are evergreen and play a significant role in the photosynthesis process of mango trees. Mango leaves are also known for their medicinal properties and are widely used in traditional medicine, as well as in cultural and religious rituals.
uses: Preparation of herbal teas and extracts for medicinal purposes.
Used in religious ceremonies and decorations.
Traditional remedies for managing diabetes and respiratory issues.
Source of antioxidants and natural compounds for health benefits.

soil.type: Well-drained, sandy loam soils with good fertility

climate.watering: Mango trees require moderate watering, especially during the growth and flowering stages. Avoid overwatering to prevent root diseases.

background.cause: Fungal disease thriving in humid and wet conditions.
background.spread_by: Rain splashes, wind, and infected plant material.

cure: Spray copper-based fungicides during high humidity periods.
Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruits.
Avoid overhead irrigation.
diseases.fertilizers: Balanced fertilizers with potassium and phosphorus.
prevention: Plant resistant mango varieties where available.
Prune trees to improve air circulation.
Apply preventive fungicides during wet seasons.
